metadata.titel_preek: Easter Trilogy: Darkness, Doubt, and Dust

locutie.beschrijving: The preacher provides a narrative-theological exposition of the Easter events and Job's encounter with God, focusing on the themes of darkness, human limitation, and the inconceivability of resurrection.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: High. Strong emphasis on Johannine symbolism (light/dark) and the literary structure of Job.

illocutie.beschrijving: The force is primarily assertive (explaining the text) with significant moments of commissive force (proclaiming the promise) toward the end of each section.
voorbeelden: I proclaim to you today... the living Word of God.
The risen, living, reigning Christ says to us today...
He has power to grant his divine life to all who come to him.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: Faith, comfort in suffering, and the silencing of human 'why' questions in favor of the divine 'Who'.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Explicitly stated in the conclusion: 'Through the Word of God the Holy Spirit creates such faith'.

voorbeelden: The symbolism of night and darkness pervades the Gospel of John.
Jesus has entered the realm of Death.
The book of Job gives no answer at all to the problem of suffering.
Let our answer be hers.
Remember this.
Look at it!
It is a very comforting thing to me.
I remember reading about it.
I believe we can hold on to the promise.
He promises you life (implied in 'grant his divine life').
We proclaim to you today... the living Word.
God has entered our pain.
commissieven.kwaliteit: Strong but often framed as 'proclaiming a truth' rather than 'bestowing a gift' directly.

voorbeelden: Alleluia! Christ is risen!
The Lord is risen indeed!
Grant that we... may be raised.
declaratieven.autoriteit: High in liturgical formulas, moderate in the body of the sermon.

indicatoren: Extensive retelling of the biblical narrative (John 20, Job).
Lengthy explanations of Greek mythology and cultural burial customs.
Analysis of 'what the evangelist wants us to know'.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer becomes a spectator of a biblical drama rather than a participant in a current event.

missende_elementen: Direct address of the promise ('I promise you' vs 'The Bible says God promises')
performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: Intellectual agreement without necessarily feeling the 'strike' of the Word.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: Theologically sound but often mediated through the third person.
voorbeelden: receive the gift of eternal light and life in his name
having power to grant his divine life to all who come to him

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Direct address to the hearer's experience of death and doubt.
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Used effectively to bridge the gap between the text and the hearer's life.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Describing Mary, Thomas, Job, and Jesus.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a narrative distance that requires a 'bridge' to the present.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: The preacher moves from the darkness of the text (Assertive) to the reality of the hearer's death (Assertive/Expressive) to the promise of the Risen Christ (Commissive/Declarative).
voorbeelden: You will come to know the cold clasp of death... [Assertive] -> The risen Christ says to us today... [Commissive]
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: Excellent transition from indicative to performative.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: Despite the high word count of 'talking about' the text, the preacher successfully pivots to a performative address that treats the Word as a living power.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: Have you buried someone? If you haven’t, you will.
sterke_punten.effect: Forces the hearer out of spectator mode.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: Lengthy retelling of the Peter/John race to the tomb.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: The sermon becomes an event when it addresses the 'you' in the context of the 'Who' of God.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The use of liturgical 'Alleluia' and the 'Toezegging' (Promise) at the end of each movement creates a sacramental rhythm.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: Yes, God is the 'Who' who answers.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: Yes, 'We proclaim to you today... the living Word of God'.
tekstueel_bewijs: The living Word of God, which is unique and trustworthy.

pneumatologie.geest_rol_erkend: Yes, explicitly in the Job section and prayers.
pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: Yes, faith is described as the Spirit's work.
tekstueel_bewijs: The Holy Spirit creates such faith in those who gladly hear.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: Yes, the Word is 'living and active'.
sacramentstheologie.epifanisch_taalgebruik: Yes, especially in the description of the 'Who' appearing to Job and Thomas.
tekstueel_bewijs: The living Son of God had appeared to him personally.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is heavy on past-tense narrative verbs. Increasing present-tense performative verbs would sharpen the 'event' character.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: Jesus’s body had simply passed through them.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: Even now, the Risen Christ passes through the locked doors of your heart.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Moves from a historical observation to a present encounter.

toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Maintain the current strength of the 'Toezegging'.
voorbeeldzinnen: I announce to you: the darkness is passing and the true light is already shining.

adressering_verbetering.probleem: Occasional 'we' can feel like a generalisation.
adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Use 'you' more pointedly in the promise.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterful example of how to use narrative to build toward a performative climax.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: Unlike SvT, which would focus on the preacher's 'self-disclosure' about doubt, SAT focuses on the 'Divine Act' of the Word creating faith.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: The power here is not in the preacher's eloquence but in the 'Commissives' where God binds Himself to the hearer.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that the sermon's success is not in 'explaining' the resurrection but in 'proclaiming' it as a current reality.

appendices.notities: The sermon successfully avoids the 'lecture' trap by grounding its assertions in the existential 'you' of the hearer.
